lexUnit.name: momentary.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: continuing or occuring only briefly; fleeting

sentence.text: The misunderstanding provided a convenient excuse for his momentary confusion .
There was a momentary hesitation while he considered the implications , but it was one of the many challenges he could n't let go .
There was a momentary hesitation , so that I half expected him to say she was n't there .
There was a momentary silence as she waited for his answer .
There was a momentary silence as she averted her gaze again , and she was aware of him picking up his coffee-cup and drinking .
I fear that , through momentary inattention , or a moralistic rejection of the evidence , I may have wasted your valuable time . "
We had a momentary chill when they climbed aboard … piracy ?
They have a very hard time saying no to momentary pleasures , regardless of the risks or consequences .
He paused , feeling a momentary pity for the old man .
I had a momentary qualm ; what would he read into the carefully closed flaps ?
Here Karlinsky turned to Miriam Levy , drawing momentary blushes to her cheeks .
There was a momentary pause .
He suspected that if he were to walk into the newsroom and make an arrest there would be only a momentary gasp before someone was out with the first of a new crop of jokes .
` I think , after all , what you probably are is a perfectly respectable wife and mother , and that all you 're guilty of is a momentary lapse . "
He took pity on her , driving himself inside her so deeply , her virginity causing him only momentary check .
Taking advantage of Guy 's momentary stupefaction , she wriggled out from under him and leapt off the bed , everything forgotten but the need to escape from something she dared not put a name to .
Resting her head wearily against the hard banister rail , she fought down the momentary surge of panic .
The presentation of a petition could have a dramatic , if momentary , effect on parliament .
He hesitated -- childbirth , like all things uniquely feminine , was considered unclean -- but to his credit the hesitation was only momentary .
But her action was only momentary , and , ` I 'm sorry , " she whispered almost at once .

This closure is only momentary because of the differentiating action of the coupling components capacitor C6 and resistor R21 , and the rest of the circuit is then activated in the way already explained .
And an ordinary lightning flash is simply the breaking down of the insulating properties of air which discharges a momentary electric current to those clouds .
Thus , the sequence of momentary and isolated percepts is determined by what has directly preceded it and results in a fusion of newly perceived aspects with those that are already held in memory .
